Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk systemtap
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: systemtap bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: SystemTap is an instrumentation system for systems running the Linux kernel, which allows developers to write scripts to collect data on the operation of the system. The devtoolset-3-systemtap packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of SystemTap. The systemtap package has been upgraded to upstream version 2.6, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. New features have been added related to UEFI SecureBoot support, boot-time probing, function callee probing, improved error messages, better statement probing, improved function prolog endings detection, DWARF type support for integer expressions, on-the-fly probe, arming and disarming, support for multiple scripts, DWARF process(PID) probes, PLT return probes, ".nearest" probes, ".statement" lineno ranges and enumerations, and improved listing mode. Additional changes have been added to better support ppc64 and aarch64. (BZ#1107735) Detailed information is available at: https://sourceware.org/ml/systemtap/2014-q2/msg00103.html https://sourceware.org/ml/systemtap/2014-q3/msg00231.html Users of systemtap are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
